intro: Mikania houstonioides, commonly known as Houston's vine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial vine characterized by its rapid growth and climbing habit. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters. It is native to Central and South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its aggressive growth, it can become invasive in certain regions.
